intro: Nashia myrtifolia, commonly known as the myrtleleaf nashia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinct, slightly hairy texture. Nashia myrtifolia is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and pleasant scent.
